column4: anyone know why the system monitor reports CPS usages over 100% ?
Interesting.
so, are all apps on linux dual core compatible then?
All apps will work with dual core CPUs, but many will only utilize one core at a time.
What is the output of "rfkill list"?
soft block no, hard block yes
I assume you've tried rfkill unblock?
Not yet, wasn't aware of that.
Doesn't seem to undo the hard block.
Didn't expect it to (but it was worth trying). Is there any option for this in the BIOS?

and Dr_Willis :: It might be worthy of note to say that my wifi button doesn't do anything,. and the status light (for on/off) acts as an activity light, switching between orange and blue as wireless network activity occurs.
There isn't an option in the BIOS. Closest thing I have found has been enabling booting from a network.
Have you tried calling the manufacturer?
No, And I don't suspect they would care to talk to me. I bought this laptop used off of ebay about 3 weeks ago.
Also, if it was working and stable, it should be able to become so again, shouldn't it?
Yes, but it may require a hardware fix rather than a software one.
Hmm, would there be any way for me to determine that one way or another myself and then preform the fix on my own?
I don't know, you might ask in ##hardware
Did you get my answer before I lost my connection?
no, I did not.
You can get to a terminal via ctrl+alt+F1 (ctrl+alt+F7 to get back) then run "DISPLAY=:0.0 metacity --replace"
